events.message: The applicant submitted a personal loan application to cover upcoming wedding expenses and some existing credit card debt consolidation.
The application was reviewed and correctly categorised as a personal loan due to the applicant’s stated purpose for wedding and debt repayment.
A loan officer was assigned to manage the case and began preparing for the initial review and documentation requirements.
Initial review confirmed all mandatory fields on the application were completed, but some clarifications on employment status were needed.
Additional documents such as proof of income, wedding budget estimates, and recent bank statements were requested from the applicant.
The applicant promptly submitted all requested documents, including pay slips and bank statements confirming stable income.
Credit check was performed and revealed a good credit score with no recent delinquencies, supporting loan approval possibilities.
Risk assessment considered the personal use nature of the loan and applicant’s financial history, concluding a moderate risk level.
A loan offer with competitive interest rates and reasonable repayment terms was presented to the applicant for review.
The applicant provided positive feedback expressing satisfaction with the interest rate and requested a slight modification of repayment start date.
The application was escalated to the senior credit committee for approval of the requested customized repayment terms.
The senior credit committee approved the personal loan with the modified repayment schedule as requested by the applicant.
Loan funds were successfully disbursed to the applicant’s bank account, enabling timely preparations for the wedding and debt repayment.
Follow-up communication was made to ensure the applicant was managing repayments as planned without any financial difficulties.
The loan application case was formally closed after all processes were completed and initial disbursement was confirmed successful.
